sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• technetium Tc 99m besilesomab has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU)
  • allow an interval of at least 2 days between scintigraphy with other technetium Tc 99m-labelled agents and administration of technetium Tc 99m besilesomab
  • no established criteria is available to distinguish infection and inflammation using technetium Tc 99m besilesomab imaging
  • Nuclear medicine imaging procedure - Osteomyelitis; Diagnosis: 0.25 to 1 mg (400 to 800 megabecquerel) IV (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and efficacy in pediatric patients less than 18 years not established

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment: no dose adjustment necessary
  • hepatic impairment: no dose adjustment necessary
  • elderly: no dose adjustment necessary

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Nuclear medicine imaging procedure - Osteomyelitis; Diagnosis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• human anti-mouse antibody (HAMA), positive result on screening test
  • hypersensitivity to other murine antibodies
  • hypersensitivity to technetium Tc 99m besilesomab or any component of the product
  • pregnancy

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• anaphylactic or anaphylactoid reactions may occur; appropriate facilities and personnel should be available during administration.
  • carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA)-expressing tumors; false-positive findings may occur
  • concurrent administration of substances which inhibit inflammation or affect the hematopoietic system (eg, antibiotics and corticosteroids); false-negative findings may occur; use not recommended with technetium Tc 99m besilesomab or a short time before administration.
  • hereditary problems of fructose intolerance; use not recommended due to the sorbitol component
  • malignancies, hematological, including myeloma; false-positive findings may occur
  • neutrophil defects, diseases involving; false-positive findings may occur

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Hypotension (1% to less than 10%)
  • Immunologic:Antibody development (14%)
Serious
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Other:Anaphylaxis (0.01% to less than 0.1%)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • use proper procedures for handling and disposal of radiopharmaceuticals
  • radionucleotide is not part of the kit
  • inject 5 mL NS into vial labelled Solvent for Scintimun and shake smoothly
  • transfer 1 mL of Solvent for Scintimun into vial of besilesomab and swirl carefully without shaking
  • place vial of reconstituted besilesomab into appropriate lead shielding container and inject 2 to 7 mL of pertechnetate Tc 99m into vial and swirl carefully without shaking
  • activity must be between 400 and 1800 megabecquerel in a total volume of 3 to 8 mL
  • solution for injection is ready for use 10 minutes after radiolabeling is complete
  • do not store reconstituted and radiolabeled product above 25 degrees C
  • protect final radiolabeled injection solution from light and administer IV within 3 hours of preparation
  • ensure patients are well hydrated to obtain the best quality images and to reduce bladder radiation exposure
